posts.post_content:
@Sixty3Zero  
  
see rulings of [Dark Impostor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Impostor):  
   
"If an activated ability of a card in exile references the card it's printed on by name, treat Dark Impostor's version of that ability as though it referenced Dark Impostor by name instead. For example, if Marrow Bats (which says "Pay 4 life: Regenerate Marrow Bats") is exiled with Dark Impostor, Dark Impostor has the ability "Pay 4 life: Regenerate Dark Impostor.""  
  
i guess the same would be true for Experiment Kraj
posts.html:
@Sixty3Zero

see rulings of Dark Impostor:

"If an activated ability of a card in exile references the card it's printed on by name, treat Dark Impostor's version of that ability as though it referenced Dark Impostor by name instead. posts.post_content: Incredible card (and my personal favorite) with limitless combos. Within the simic guild itself, it can instantly make any creature targetable by your graft creatures (such as using [Plaxcaster Frogling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plaxcaster Frogling) to give shroud to a creature thats about to be enchanted) and works especially well with the [Vigean Graftmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vigean Graftmage) to either add a +1/+1 counter to any creature for two mana or steal and use any activated ability in the same turn and continue to use that ability for each two additional mana you spend. Using eventide, Kraj can put a counter on the [Gilder Bairn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gilder Bairn) and in the following turns can then add 1 to and double the number of counters on any creature for only three mana and when all is said and done, Kraj is still untapped, able to use any ability that it has stolen. Lastly, I can't even begin to list the number of combos that can occur in two-headed giant.
posts.html:

Using eventide, Kraj can put a counter on the Gilder Bairn and in the following turns can then add 1 to and double the number of counters on any creature for only three mana and when all is said and done, Kraj is still untapped, able to use any ability that it has stolen. Lastly, I can't even begin to list the number of combos that can occur in two-headed giant.

Posted By: Nantuko_Primus (6/8/2009 12:41:32 PM)

posts.post_content:
@Frommerman  
  
You need to read those rules again :P  
  
606.2. An activated ability with a loyalty symbol in its cost is a loyalty ability. **Normally, only planeswalkers have loyalty abilities**.  
  
**606.3. A player may activate a loyalty ability of a permanent he or she controls any time he or she has priority and the stack is empty during a main phase of his or her turn, but only if no player has previously activated a loyalty ability of that permanent that turn.**  
  
Highlighted the important parts :)  
  
This is found under the section of Loyalty abilities, see it's not about whether it's a planeswalker or not, the loyalty abilities themselves have the clause that you can't use it more than once per turn, this is stated in the rules, so you'd be able to use the abilities, but only once per turn as it's still a loyalty ability even though it's not a planeswalker using it.
posts.html:
@Frommerman

You need to read those rules again :P

606.2. An activated ability with a loyalty symbol in its cost is a loyalty ability. Normally, only planeswalkers have loyalty abilities.

606.3. A player may activate a loyalty ability of a permanent he or she controls any time he or she has priority and the stack is empty during a main phase of his or her turn, but only if no player has previously activated a loyalty ability of that permanent that turn.

Highlighted the important parts :)

This is found under the section of Loyalty abilities, see it's not about whether it's a planeswalker or not, the loyalty abilities themselves have the clause that you can't use it more than once per turn, this is stated in the rules, so you'd be able to use the abilities, but only once per turn as it's still a loyalty ability even though it's not a planeswalker using it.

posts.post_content:
Here's a tip for people looking for good abilities to combo with him: Advanced search for Rules Text: ":", Type: "creature", and Colors: Green OR Blue OR Colorless, with exclude unselected colors check.  
  
This'll bring up quite of lot of interesting cards.  
  
Anyway, I personally like to combo this guy with [Sentinel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sentinel) and a regen ability.
posts.html:
Here's a tip for people looking for good abilities to combo with him: Advanced search for Rules Text: ":", Type: "creature", and Colors: Green OR Blue OR Colorless, with exclude unselected colors check.

This'll bring up quite of lot of interesting cards.

Anyway, I personally like to combo this guy with Sentinel and a regen ability.

Question: I came up with a combo that essentially chews up and spits out the rules of the game. Does this work?  
  
1. Have[Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice), [March of the Machines](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=March of the Machines), and this out.  
2. Play any planeswalker  
3. The planeswalker is an artifact creature while also being a planeswalker  
4. Put a +1/+1 counter on the planeswalker  
5. Theoretically, Experiment Kraj now has all activated abilities of the planeswalker. However, rules pertaining to the use of planeswalker abilities only once per turn only apply to planeswalkers and (I may be wrong) do not cause the planeswalker to tap. posts.post_content:
My new musings on Experiment Kraj are that he Looks Like Ivan Ooze and Gatherer needs like a bazillion more Ivan Ooze related comments about him. ^\_^  
  
THE BELOW INFORMATION IS SO FAR INACCURATE  
it's horribly complicated, not practical for a normal game, but it works. Blame the Simic guild, because Experiment Kraj really can do this. [Sorin, Lord of Innistrad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sorin, Lord of Innistrad) is vital, because without his ability to REANIMATE Planeswalkers, you WOULD be limited by a '1 per turn' activation issue. There is a very, very, very good reason that Sorin's wording says 'other' planeswalkers. Wizards knows that if Sorin ever got targeted by his own Ultimate, all hell breaks loose. It's to try to stop Mad Johnnies from pulling this kind of bullcrap. The first iteration involved a subcombo with Tezzeret the Seeker because I thought I needed it. The whole point of the Tezzeret bit was to get a +1/+1 counter on Sorin, allowing Kraj to copy Sorin's ability. There are better ways to get a +1/+1 cou... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

There is a very, very, very good reason that Sorin's wording says 'other' planeswalkers. Wizards knows that if Sorin ever got targeted by his own Ultimate, all hell breaks loose. posts.post_content:
If you use [mycosynth lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mycosynth lattice) and [march of the machines](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=march of the machines) Experiment Kraj can have the loyalty abilities of one of each type of planeswalker.  
  
Mycosynth Lattice makes them all Artifact Planeswalkers  
March of Machine makes them all Artifact Creature Planeswalkers  
  
Note that this also works with [enchanted evening](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=enchanted evening) + [Opalescence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Opalescence)  
  
Just for reference, here are some rules about loyalty abilities that are worth looking at. Unless I put it in quotes, I am paraphrasing or making a point about that rule. If you are going to be doing crazy convoluted combos, do a little research and make sure it works.  
  
112.5 The 1/turn loyalty ability rule. It applies to permanents, not just planeswalkers  
119.3c Damage removing loyalty counters only applies to planeswalkers  
209.2 The definition of a loyalty abilities specifies that it is an activated ability with a loyalty symbol in it's cost  
306.5 Some people get confused by this on... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
If you use mycosynth lattice and march of the machines Experiment Kraj can have the loyalty abilities of one of each type of planeswalker.

Mycosynth Lattice makes them all Artifact Planeswalkers
March of Machine makes them all Artifact Creature Planeswalkers

Note that this also works with enchanted evening + Opalescence

Just for reference, here are some rules about loyalty abilities that are worth looking at. Unless I put it in quotes, I am paraphrasing or making a point about that rule. If you are going to be doing crazy convoluted combos, do a little research and make sure it works.

112.5 The 1/turn loyalty ability rule. It applies to permanents, not just planeswalkers
119.3c Damage removing loyalty counters only applies to planeswalkers
209.2 The definition of a loyalty abilities specifies that it is an activated ability with a loyalty symbol in it's cost
306.5 Some people get confused by this on... (see all)
